qas.question: Where are agents sent to become FBI Special Agents?
How long is the course required for all special agents?
What other groups does the FBI Academy train?

answers.text: state and local law enforcement agencies

qas.question: Where is the CIA academy located?
What is not required to become a Special Agent?
When did the FBI Academy close?

plausible_answers.text: Forensic Science Research and Training Center

qas.question: What is a CIA unit that resides at Quantico?

plausible_answers.text: state and local law enforcement agencies

qas.question: Who does the Academy not train?

context: <a0_0>The FBI Academy<a0_0/>, located in <a1_0><b4_0>Quantico, Virginia<b4_0/><a1_0/>, is home to the communications and computer laboratory the FBI utilizes. It is also where new agents are sent for training to become FBI Special Agents. Going through the <a2_0><b5_0>21-week<a2_0/> course<b5_0/> is required for every Special Agent. First opened for use in <b6_0>1972<b6_0/>, the facility located on 385 acres (1.6 km2) of woodland. The Academy trains <a3_0><b8_0>state and local law enforcement agencies<b8_0/><a3_0/>, which are invited to the law enforcement training center. The FBI units that reside at Quantico are the Field and Police Training Unit, Firearms Training Unit, <b7_0>Forensic Science Research and Training Center<b7_0/>, Technology Services Unit (TSU), Investigative Training Unit, Law Enforcement Communication Unit, Leadership and Management Science Units (LSMU), Physical Training Unit, New Agents' Training Unit (NATU), Practical Applications Unit (PAU), the Investigative Computer Training Unit and the "College of Analytical Studies."
